DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this trial is to study fluorodeoxyglucose-positron emission tomography (FDG-PET)-based dose escalation using intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT).
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study of Incorporating 18F-FDG-PET Imaging in Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: The dose escalation, based on the FDG-PET signal, is incorporated in the first ten fractions of the radiotherapeutic treatment. The total amount of fractions is 32, equal to a standard radiotherapeutic treatment for these types of cancers.
DOC.criteria: Patients with a proven histological squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx (only T34 NO or Tany N+), hypopharynx, oropharynx Patients who did not undergo surgery for the primary tumor location Patients with a Karnofsky performance score of 70% or more Written informed consent for participation in this trial Other malignancy except for nonmelanoma skin cancer Prior irradiation to the head and neck region
DOC.keyword: neoplasms (squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck region)
